fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
* set up a few versions in JIRA, e.g: 5.1, 5.2.1, 5.2.2, 5.3
* go to the issue navigator and switch to advanced search
* type {{fixVersion = "5.2}} and wait for the auto-complete. in the suggestions we have: 5.2.1, 5.2.2
* now type {{fixVersion = 5.2}} (notice the lack of quotes). in the suggestions we have: 5.1, 5.2.1, 5.2.2, 5.3 (!)
fields.summary: JQL auto-complete not working for versions that have a decimal point "." in the version name

fields.description:
Steps to replicate this:

* Log into a given instance, for example https://cgauterio.jira-dev.com/ and check the *Keep me logged in* option
* Close the browser
* Open the browser one more time and try to access the following link: https://cgauterio.jira-dev.com/secure/ManageFilters.jspa - the user will be logged into the instance
* Close the browser again
* Open the browser and try accessing the following link: https://cgauterio.jira-dev.com/ManageFilters.jspa
* The user will NOT be logged in, and if you click on the "Log In" link at the top right, you will be automatically logged into the instance and the login form will not be displayed.

I believe both URLs should behave on the same way.
fields.summary: /secure/ManageFilters.jspa and /ManageFilters.jspa behave differently - OD only

fields.description:
When I go into an issue screen, JIRA displays that the issue is resolved ("Finalizado", in our language). On the other hand, when I search for the issue in the "Search for Issues" menu, it shows that the issue is in a previous status ("Em Aprovação", in our case), which is wrong.
I would like to know a way to solve it, to display the same status in both screens.

Both status can be seen in the attached pictures.
fields.summary: Inconsistency while displaying issue status

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30661].
  {panel}

I would like the ability to have global transitions that cross multiple workflows, and the ability to edit a transition and have it take place across multiple workflows.

It is inevitable that projects will have their own necessary workflow but what is common are the transitions that are used, whether it is a custom one, or one that is provided out of the box.  I would like the ability to use a true global transition that would allow me to define specific behavior no matter what workflow is used. Of course, I could retain the ability to have a localized transition for that workflow.

Example:

After running JIRA for nearly a year, we have had a new growth of users, projects, and workflows. It was requested, several times, that we zero out the remaining estimate when closing an issue. Since this change is global, I had to edit each customized workflow to include this post function. That was very time consuming.

In the future we plan to introduce software approvals via the workflow. Each customized workflow will have to have all the approval transitions and statuses added. If a change of any kind is needed, each customized workflow using those transitions must be modified.

In the above example, it would be great to set true global transitions so that I can add the "Approved for Beta" status on the design form, and drag the transition (which I have already set properties, conditions, validations, and post functions for) between my two preferred states. This way, if it was determined that we wanted a new post function to happen globally, I can go to one place, make my change, and have it become active across all workflows that use that true global transition.

Another great method is to have sub-workflows. Using the same software approval example; The approval process will start after the Resolved status and before Closed. I would like to add the "Approval sub-workflow" to start from the Resolved state. In the design view, I look at my available sub-workflows, select the Approval sub-workflow and drag it to the Resolved state. All the statuses and transitions the sub-workflow contains will be copied over. During the copy I will be prompted to choose to copy locally, or keep the sub-workflow linked globally (global means I modify the sub-workflow - all workflows and projects that use it is changed).  This method goes one step better than global transitions as an entire portion of the workflow can be added and I can maintain a 'change once, apply everywhere' mantra.

If there is currently a method to achieve what I want, please let me know.

Thanks!
fields.summary: True global workflow transitions and sub-workflow
Enable use of x-forwarded-for to log browser IP addresses

fields.description:
We support a JIRA (and other Atlassian Tolls) instance and would like to use an Issue Collector, to provide a unified way to log support requests across all tools.

When including it in JRIA (we use the Announcement Banner to include the code snippet), the gadgets on JIRA's dashboard, overlap the trigger, making it unusable.

I would expect the triggers to be layered on top of all other page elements.
fields.summary: When using an Issue Collector with the trigger style "Subtle" in JIRA itself, the gadgets on JIRA's dashboard overlap the trigger, but the trigger should be layered on top.

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 5-Dec-2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hello, everyone! We have analyzed this request and found that this bug request is quite wide in scope and does does not fit our current standards for bug reports. At this time we create bug request for specific functions not working as expected, and we can find several more specific bugs like:
* [JRASERVER-67760 Click on ' Add tab ' button multiple times on issue screen configuration will cause multiple requests to be sent when ' Add ' button is pressed later on|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-67760].
* [JRASERVER-67555 Duplicate system fields when creating new issue type screen scheme screen tabs|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-67555].
* [JRASERVER-37267 duplicate issues created when clicking on create button multiple times|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37267].

With this in mind, we will be closing this request and please watch/vote for the scenarios you are experiencing/being affected by, as well as to help us identify any other possible variations by reporting them to our support team.

Best regards,
René Chiquete - JAC Champion
{panel}

Currently it's possible to click on form submissions multiple times and have JIRA post duplicate data in the database.

For example, if a user clicks on Log Work multiple times ( probably due to the server responding slowly ) JIRA will enter duplicate entries.

See attached screenshot.

*Workaround*
Probably the only thing we can do to prevent this is using JavaScript to hide the Post button after the user clicks it
fields.summary: Prevent duplicate form actions from happening - regression

fields.description:
The JIRA logo is, by default, upon a dark blue background (#205081, the Header Background Colour).

Now consider a 404 page: https://jira.atlassian.com/404. The logo is displayed upon a light background (#f0f0f0, apparently not customisable from inside JIRA).

The default logo provided by JIRA is white with transparent background. This looks good on the dark blue, but does not look good on the 404 page. Others may have logos with a non-transparent background which would then clash somewhat with the different coloured background. It would be cosmetically nicer if it were placed in a header bar similar in nature and background colour to the regular page's one (or, though probably undesirable, omitted).
fields.summary: 404 page displays logo on a different background colour to its usual colour

fields.description: When viewing an issue as an administrator (I believe), the toolbar menu _More Actions_ contains three links at the end: "Where is my field?", "Permission Helper" and "Notification Helper". Each of these three is actuated by JavaScript, but its raw link is to {{/notimportant}}, which does not exist. This breaks the principles of progressive enhancement as it will not function without JavaScript. Opening the link in a new tab will also fail where I am accustomed to having it work (thanks, Atlassian! I like that attention to detail).
fields.summary: More Actions for issues contains broken links to /notimportant for administrative field/permission/notification helpers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30643].
  {panel}

h3. Summary: 

If the default {{jira}} workflow is copied and a transition is cloned with a different name, the cloned name will appear in the issue view screen for the transition buttons.
E.g when I clone a transition, and specify a new name, the new transition keeps the old transition's name, so I have two (for example) 'Start Progress' buttons.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:

# Copy the {{jira}} system workflow.
# Edit it with the workflow designer.
# Add a new transition, cloning the Start Progress Transition, providing it with a different name.
# Create a new workflow scheme, assigning the new workflow to it and then assign it to a project.
# View an issue in the appropriate status for that transition. The transition will not have the new name.

h3. Expected Results:

The transition has the name as defined within the workflow designer.

h3. Actual Results:

The new transition has the name of the cloned transition. This appears to be caused by cloning the following elements:
{code:XML}
          <meta name="opsbar-sequence">20</meta>
          <meta name="jira.i18n.title">stopprogress.title</meta>
{code}

h3. Regression:

Not a regression. This is not existant in the ViewWorkflowSteps.jspa editor as that functionality is not available. Tested back to 4.4.5 and this was present.

h3. Notes:

XML of a transition created from scratch:
{code:XML}
        <action id="731" name="New Transition">
          <meta name="jira.description"></meta>
          <results>
            <unconditional-result old-status="Not Done" status="Done" step="3">
              <post-functions>
                <function type="class">
                  <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.UpdateIssueStatusFunction</arg>
                </function>
                <function type="class">
                  <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.misc.CreateCommentFunction</arg>
                </function>
                <function type="class">
                  <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.GenerateChangeHistoryFunction</arg>
                </function>
                <function type="class">
                  <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.IssueReindexFunction</arg>
                </function>
                <function type="class">
                  <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.event.FireIssueEventFunction</arg>
                  <arg name="eventTypeId">13</arg>
                </function>
              </post-functions>
            </unconditional-result>
          </results>
        </action>
{code}

XML of a cloned transition:
{code:XML}
        <action id="711" name="I HAS A DIFFERENT NAME">
          <meta name="opsbar-sequence">20</meta>
          <meta name="jira.i18n.title">stopprogress.title</meta>
          <meta name="jira.description"></meta>
          <restrict-to>
            <conditions>
              <condition type="class">
                <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.condition.AllowOnlyAssignee</arg>
              </condition>
            </conditions>
          </restrict-to>
          <results>
            <unconditional-result old-status="Not Done" status="Done" step="4">
              <post-functions>
                <function type="class">
                  <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.UpdateIssueFieldFunction</arg>
                  <arg name="field.value"></arg>
                  <arg name="field.name">resolution</arg>
                </function>
                <function type="class">
                  <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.UpdateIssueStatusFunction</arg>
                </function>
                <function type="class">
                  <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.misc.CreateCommentFunction</arg>
                </function>
                <function type="class">
                  <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.GenerateChangeHistoryFunction</arg>
                </function>
                <function type="class">
                  <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.IssueReindexFunction</arg>
                </function>
                <function type="class">
                  <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.event.FireIssueEventFunction</arg>
                  <arg name="eventTypeId">12</arg>
                </function>
              </post-functions>
            </unconditional-result>
          </results>
        </action>
{code}

h3. Workaround:

To update the title of the button, Please follow the steps below:

# Choose Cog > Issues
# Choose 'Workflows' under the WORKFLOWS section
# Click the Edit link in the desired workflow
# Click the link of the transition with the wrong title
# Click View Properties
# Delete the jira.i18n.title property from the transition.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30639].
  {panel}

During a data import process (like CSV), JIRA is considering "unassigned" as a new user account. So, the customer will have some issues to remove the user.

Steps to reproduce:

# Create new unassigned issue
# Import a CSV file with the following content:
{code}
Summary, Assignee, Reporter, Issue Type, Description, Priority
"Test issue", admin, admin, 1,,
"secound issue",unassigned,unassigned,1,,
{code}

After, the administrator will be unable to remove the related user account.
Also, the following [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Importing+Data+from+CSV] doesn't have something about this.

Cheers,

Paulo Renato

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30628].
  {panel}

Services need to be more isolated from JIRA as a whole, and from each other. Services need to be restartable in the event of deadlock.

Problems with the current system:

* Restarting the whole instance may require intervention from the IT department.
* Restarting the whole instance restarts all services, when only restarting one may be needed.
* An administrator can not restart a service without restarting Tomcat.
* One service crashing, will take out all others.
fields.summary: Improve service isolation

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce*:

Follow all the steps to generate a self-signed certificate as described in [Running JIRA over SSL or HTTPS| https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS].

When you try to use the set the certificate path in the _JIRA Configuration Tool_ the following is shown:

!Screen Shot 2012-11-19 at 3.38.16 PM.png!

It's complaining about the lack of the Private Key, but the key is where it should be in the User's root directory:

{noformat}
laptop:~ pcora$ keytool -list -alias tomcat -keystore ~/.keystore 
Enter keystore password:  
tomcat, Nov 19, 2012, PrivateKeyEntry, 
Certificate fingerprint (MD5): 00:A0:94:5C:B7:BB:FD:D9:D1:BC:8D:46:03:80:5E:02
{noformat}

And also the trustedCertEntry:

{noformat}
laptop:~ pcora$ keytool -list -alias tomcat -keystore $JAVA_HOME/lib/security/cacerts 
Enter keystore password:  
tomcat, Nov 19, 2012, trustedCertEntry,
Certificate fingerprint (MD5): 00:A0:94:5C:B7:BB:FD:D9:D1:BC:8D:46:03:80:5E:02
{noformat}

*Actual Results:*
Using the _JIRA Configuration Tool_ prevents you to properly configure SSL in JIRA.

*Expected Results:*

The user places the Key Store path and JIRA accepts it.

*Workaround:*

Follow the old way to configure, which is described in http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA051/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS

OR

Generate key and import it to the keystore using one line command(to avoid exporting and importing):
{code}
keytool -genkey -alias <your_preferred_alias> -keyalg RSA -keystore <location_to_keystore>
{code}
fields.summary: JIRA Configuration Tool won't find PrivateKeyEntry

  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 22 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

At this time, this suggestion is not on the JIRA development roadmap. We stand by our original decision to remove this feature when we redesigned issue search several years ago.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

Once again, your short sightedness on what is useful has struck again.  This is a request to put back the JQL History mechanism.   Here are some comments from the 5.2 upgrade notes page.

--------------------
JQL history is immensely useful. I'm often looking at issues and just wish to perform transient searches...searches that *I do not want to save*. The JQL history serves as a convenient place that automatically saves these *drafts*.

Another use case, when I'm fine tuning searches, I need to jump back and forth between statements to see what they produced.

Ironically, Favorite Filters are the ones I use the least because like browser bookmarks, you eventually accumulate so much that the old stuff has no meaningful purpose to you anymore, and you don't have time to unfavorite them.
--------------------
I totally agree with the feedback given by Anonymous on November 14th:  the JQL History is (was) incredibly useful when developing a good query...  and that fiddling comes *before* it is saved as a Filter.  I do not want to have to save my experiments as Filters.  That would cause problems in itself...  many of the experiments would be failures and thus just create clutter that needs to be cleaned up manually later.
--------------------
fields.summary: Restore JQL History
Document your new limits

fields.description:
h1. Symptoms

Workflow stops working for all issues after publishing its draft. For example:

* JIRA may complain about an issue being in an illegal status. 
* No transitions may be available to an issue. 

h1. Cause

It is possible for an inactive workflow to have a draft. In this mode is is possible to change the parent workflow in a way that makes the draft incompatible. Publishing this draft, after the parent workflow is associated with a project, can result in the workflow and the issues being out of sync.
fields.summary: Workflow stops working for all issues after publishing its draft.

{code} 

Moreover, it is not possible to delete the project containing the corrupted issues.
I would suggest that the call validates its parameters before saving the link.
fields.summary: Programmatically setting issueLinkType to non existing value makes indexing service throw NullPointerException and all issues disappear

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30592].
  {panel}

The JIRA 5.2, under ['View Issue' and 'Issue Navigator' Shortcuts|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Using+Keyboard+Shortcuts#UsingKeyboardShortcuts-issues], the feature of "Hides or shows the left section on the Issue Navigator" is no longer available.

Expected behavior
- The feature is not exist and trigger the keyboard shortcut "[" will have nothing happen

Suggestion
- Delete the Keyboard Shortcut in the documentation
!bug 4.PNG!
fields.summary: Documentation Error - Hide/Show is no longer available.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30590].
  {panel}

When moving an Issue between two Projects that use different custom fields, user will encounter an error. This should be handled differently, with Jira allowing the user to either cleanse the data in fields that won't be used in the new project, or cancel the move.

h3. Workaround
The issues can be moved successfully if the destination Project/Issue Type is added to the context of the User Picker custom field associated to the source Project/Issue Type.
fields.summary: NullPointerException error when moving issue between projects with different custom fields

fields.description:
According to LSB standard, init script should have a header, something like:

|
{code}
#!/bin/sh -e
# Start/stop JBoss
#
### BEGIN INIT INFO
# Provides:          jira
# Required-Start:    $remote_fs $syslog $time
# Required-Stop:     $remote_fs $syslog $time
# Default-Start:     2 3 4 5
# Default-Stop:      0 1 6
# Short-Description: JIRA Issue tracking
# Description:       jira is a tomcat based issue tracking system
### END INIT INFO
{code}

h4.Workaround

Please refer to the comment provided by the Zachary [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-30589?focusedCommentId=437322&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-437322].
fields.summary: Make JIRA init script according to Linux Base Standard (LSB)
start-jira.sh will not start JIRA with root user

Streams client backlog can grow indefinitely
LocalActivityProvider does not handle exceptions properly
Plugins is reporting a module as enabled when it isn't

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30581].
  {panel}

As seen during a JAC outage (see stack trace below).  Apparently plugins and multitenancy disagree on the plugin state.  Plugins tells us it's there, but when we try to use it the multitenancy tells us that it isn't available.  The condition is apparently permanent.  It would be a good thing to figure out why this happens in the first place, but in the meantime the I18nBean should intercept the failures instead of letting them take out the cache entirely.  If the plug-in is gone, then us not getting its translations is the right answer anyway.

I'm led to understand that this has been seen before and handled much the same way.  My guess is that this was triggered by the conversion to using Google caches, which wrap the IllegalStateException in an UncheckedExecutionException.  That's silly and unhelpful and is probably contributing to the problem.

{code:java}
#https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-29112 JRA-30580
log4j.logger.com.atlassian.jira.plugins.webhooks = OFF, console, filelog
log4j.additivity.com.atlassian.jira.plugins.webhooks = false
{code}
into log4j.properties.

Credit for the workaround suggestion goes to [~lenzman].

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30572].
  {panel}

Hi. I am developing a JIRA client for Android platform, and I have a few questions. 
During first launch my app caches some data in local DB (custom fields sets, value bundles for each custom field, assignee, priority etc)
There is a request in REST API - /rest/api/2/issue/{issueIdOrKey}/editmeta 
and I can get all available custom fields (with values) and operations from this request. And there is a question: is there any situation, when this request will return different data within one project? I mean different custom fields or different value bundles for two issues created in one project. And is there any way to get a Project scheme (custom fields, bundles, etc), but not a Issue scheme. 
Thank you.

fields.description:
Hi guys, 
in jira 4.2 we were able to drag and drop a gadget between dashboards and our user liked that options. 

Since our update to jira 5.1 this option is not there anymore. 
It's still behave like it should as when we drag a gadget, the dashboard we do not own turn grey and the ones we own stay as they were. 

See screenshots. 

but when we release it. It does nothing and go back where it was on the dashboard. 

Is this option has been removed intentionnaly?

Regards
fields.summary: Moving Gadget between Dashboards not supported anymore in jira 5

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Add a filter gadget to a dashboard, configuring the max items to 50, choosing a query with 50 visible issues.
2. Next to one of the issues in the filter gadget, click on the action (gear) icon (the dropdown menu opens)
3. Click again on the same action icon (the dropdown menu closes)
4. Click a third time on the same action icon -- nothing happens.

The action menu for this issue is now broken until you reload the page.

P.S.: The behavior is similar to the one described in issue JRA-21956 (which is fixed), but my issue is about the dashboard filter gadget (where the problem persists), whereas the fixed issue is about the issue navigator (where I can confirm the problem is fixed).
fields.summary: Action dropdown in dashboard filter gadget does not open any more after being clicked 2 times (FF 16)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30562].
  {panel}

*User Recommendation*
Configure IIS to use Application Request Routing (ARR) for the reverse proxy of the JIRA Tomcat instance and besides this being a much cleaner way to host Tomcat than the ISAPI redirect. 

*Improvement Documentation*
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Integrating+JIRA+with+IIS

*Workaround*
Integrating JIRA with IIS using ARR - KB article - https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Integrating+JIRA+with+IIS+using+ARR
fields.summary: Improvement of IIS Documentation

fields.description:
We are running JIRA behind a proxy. When the proxy is not configured, the "JIRA Update Check" always shows 
{code}Congratulations!
You are running the latest version of JIRA.{code}

That was clearly wrong before I upgraded to 5.2 today, and will surely be wrong when a newer version than 5.2 will be released.


*Expected:*
Instead of giving a false positive, the Update Check should show an error message that it can't check if the installed version is the latest.
fields.summary: "JIRA Update Check" shows false positive

fields.description:
Environment: Safari 6.0.2, OS X 10.8.2.

# Enter search term (or extant issue key) in quick search bar.
# Submit quick search with Command-Return.

*Expected:* new tab opens displaying issue navigator with some filter derived from search terms (or displaying the extant issue if an issue key was entered).
*Actual:* new tab opens displaying the issue navigator with the session's current filter.

Probably not helped by the form submission sending a GET to {{/secure/QuickSearch.jspa}} that doesn't obviously include the user's input. I'm sure this used to work in 4.4 and maybe 5.earlier?
fields.summary: Quick search with results in new tab doesn't search for entered terms
